page.title: 12MELDON RESERVOIR 1
page.content: Meldon Dam and Reservoir are found in the valley of the West Okement River 3km to the west of Okehampton. The site is on the northern edge of a granite mass. Trail borings for the foundations were started in 1963. By 1970 the river had been diverted through a channel cut on the eastern side of the valley. When the builders started putting concrete in the foundations construction materials were brought from the nearby Meldon Quarry. British Rail (owners of the quarry) converted a stretch of old railway line, including Meldon Viaduct, between the quarry and the dam site, into a road for this traffic. In 1971 the river was diverted through the new dam while the other half was built. The dam was completed in 1972 and impounding of water started. CONTINUED ON NEXT PAGE
